official-title.#text:
To prohibit the Administrator of the Environmental
		  Protection Agency from finalizing any rule imposing any standard of performance
		  for carbon dioxide emissions from any existing or new source that is a fossil
		  fuel-fired electric utility generating unit unless and until carbon capture and
		  storage is found to be technologically and economically
		  feasible.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
No finalization of any
			 standard of performance for carbon dioxide emissions from any existing or new
			 fossil fuel-fired electric utility generating unit unless carbon capture and
			 storage is technologically and economically feasible

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for emissions of carbon dioxide from
			 any existing or new source that is a fossil fuel-fired electric utility
			 generating unit unless and until—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 111 of the Clean Air Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that carbon capture and storage
			 is the best system of emission reduction which (taking into account the cost of
			 achieving such reduction and any nonair health and environmental impact and
			 energy requirements) the

determines has been adequately
			 demonstrated; and

, by at least three of the following four
			 officials:

text.#text:
carbon capture and storage is found to be
			 technologically and economically feasible for fossil fuel-fired electric
			 utility generating units in a report that is published in the Federal Register,
			 and submitted to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator
			 of the Energy Information Administration

Comptroller
			 General of the United States

Director of

Under
			 Secretary of Commerce for Standards and Technology

shall not combine in the
			 same category of stationary sources—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

text.#text:
In proposing or finalizing any
			 rule imposing any standard of performance under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for emissions of carbon dioxide from any existing or new
			 source that is a fossil fuel-fired electric utility generating unit, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 111 of the Clean Air
			 Act

text.#text:
electric utility
			 steam generating units subject to subpart Da of part 60, title 40, Code of
			 Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of the enactment of this Act);
			 and

combined cycle
			 electric generating units subject to subpart KKKK of such part (as in effect on
			 such date).

term.#tail:
means the present discounted value of the revenue from the projected sale of
			 electricity from a generating unit in a competitive market over the life of a
			 unit that employs carbon capture and storage exceeds the present discounted
			 value of the cost of the unit, including costs associated with any energy
			 required to capture, compress, transport, and store carbon dioxide.
have the meanings given such term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 111(a) of
			 the Clean Air Act

term.#tail:
refers to the demonstrated operation of carbon capture and
			 storage technologies integrated with power production at an appropriate scale
			 to ensure safe and reliable production of electricity with capture and storage
			 on a widespread geographic basis.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2127 IH: To prohibit the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from finalizing any rule imposing any standard of performance for carbon dioxide emissions from any existing or new source that is a fossil fuel-fired electric utility generating unit unless and until carbon capture and storage is found to be technologically and economically feasible.
